Title.evidence: In this randomized trial of prescribed exercise versus enhanced usual care during neoadjuvant therapy for pancreatic cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: patients with pancreatic cancer were randomized

Intervention.evidence: Arm A: enhanced usual care or Arm B: prescribed aerobic and resistance exercise during neoadjuvant therapy

Objective.evidence: To determine the effects of a preoperative, home-based exercise program on fitness and physical function in patients with pancreatic cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was 6-minute walk distance (6MWD; ≥14 meters improvement was clinically meaningful).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: patients with pancreatic cancer were randomized

Result_Outcome.evidence: 6MWD improved in both Arm A (mean change 18.6±56.8 m, P =0.01) and Arm B (27.3±68.1 m, P =0.002).
